China is open to contact, talks with Canada, foreign minister saysChina does not want a continuation of the "current difficult situation" in relations with Canada, China's foreign minister told his Canadian counterpart during a phone call, the Chinese foreign ministry said in a statement late on Thursday. Thu, 11 Jan 2024 23:37:56 GMT YQHODUO3UNKVLM3QNOUF7UNKPY https://www.reuters.com/world/china-is-opening-contacts-dialogue-with-canada-chinas-foreign-minister-2024-01-11/Reuters世界

Foreigners pile $29 bln into EM portfolios in December, $179 bln in 2023 -IIFForeigners added a net $29 billion into emerging market debt and equity portfolios in December enticed by a view that the U.S. Federal Reserve will soon ease monetary policy, taking the 2023 estimated net inflow near $179 billion, the Institute of International Finance said on Thursday. Thu, 11 Jan 2024 15:06:46 GMT DCFQOVQO3JM6DD2DWD6DEFSCUQ https://www.reuters.com/markets/foreigners-pile-29-bln-into-em-portfolios-december-179-bln-2023-iif-2024-01-11/Reuters市场
Microsoft briefly overtakes Apple as world's most valuable companyMicrosoft on Thursday briefly overtook Apple as the world's most valuable company for the first time since 2021 after the iPhone maker's shares made a weak start to the year on growing concerns over demand. Thu, 11 Jan 2024 14:44:57 GMT 5UV72UCJR5PNBEMY53S6UNRONA https://www.reuters.com/technology/microsoft-overtakes-apple-worlds-most-valuable-company-2024-01-11/Aditya Soni技术
Grifols sees China stake sale going ahead despite Gotham City reportGrifols told investors on Thursday it did not foresee any problem closing its $1.8 billion sale of a stake in Shanghai RAAS, despite a slump in its shares after a Gotham City Research report this week querying the Spanish drugmaker's accounting. Thu, 11 Jan 2024 13:57:53 GMT OQDYQJZ6AZLEXIUJOHK43D72CE https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/grifols-ceo-says-gotham-report-is-wrong-pledges-improve-governance-2024-01-11/Joan Faus, Nell Mackenzie商业医疗保健与制药
China raises concerns with US over chip-making export controls, sanctionsChina's Commerce Minister Wang Wentao expressed concern over U.S. curbs preventing third countries from exporting lithography machines to China during a phone call with U.S. Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo on Thursday, his ministry said. Thu, 11 Jan 2024 11:48:45 GMT H6O45XUQWFOYPIX4RKB2AEGY3M https://www.reuters.com/technology/china-raises-concerns-with-us-over-chip-making-export-controls-sanctions-2024-01-11/Joe Cash技术

German foreign minister, in Philippines, raps China's 'risky manoeuvres' in South China SeaGermany's foreign minister criticised the Chinese coastguard's activities in the South China Sea, including its use of lasers and water cannon, during a visit on Thursday to the Philippines, saying the actions were causing concern in Europe too. Taiwan spotlights China crackdown on Hong Kong ahead of key pollAs Taiwan prepares to hold a closely watched election on Saturday, the main political parties have highlighted China's crackdown in Hong Kong and rejected Beijing's model of governance there being applied to the self-ruled island. Ex-South Korea PM to launch new party ahead of April electionA former South Korean prime minister announced on Thursday his plan to launch a new political party in a move that aims to challenge the domination of the two leading parties in parliament in the run-up to an election on April 10.
